findings.title: Possible collisions in TokenIOStorage
findings.description: User provided strings are used as storage keys in TokenIOStorage.sol, which can result in collisions in the database and unintended consequences.

findings.title: Ambiguity in keccak hashing function inputs
findings.description: The use of variable sized strings as storage keys in TokenIOStorage.sol can result in ambiguous inputs for the keccak hashing function, leading to possible collisions in the database.

findings.title: Unintended consequences due to variable sized strings
findings.description: The use of variable sized strings as storage keys in TokenIOStorage.sol can result in collisions in the database and unintended consequences. This is because dynamic sized elements in hashing inputs can lead to ambiguity in the construction of the hash.

findings.title: One major issue related to gas usage for contracts
findings.description: The gas usage for the contracts is relatively high for their intended functionality due to the storage contract abstraction and upgradable nature of the contracts.
